text: Woolgarlo is a locality on the foreshores of the Yass River arm of Lake Burrinjuck, in the far eastern part of the Riverina in the Yass Valley Shire of New South Wales, Australia. At the , it had a population of 26. ==Location and features== It is situated by road, about north east from Burrinjuck and south east from Bookham. The property was converted into a caravan and camping park during the 1960s, catering mainly to freshwater anglers and waterskiers. The caravan park was renamed Lake Burrinjuck Leisure Resort during the 1980s, but continues to be known as Woolgarlo among locals. A Woolgarlo Post Office opened on 1 May 1870 but was closed in 1872. ==References== Category:Towns in the Riverina Category:Towns in New South Wales Category:Southern Tablelands Category:Yass Valley Council
title: Woolgarlo
